TEXT.English: We would like to offer you the lands this settlement is on as a sign of our respect.
TEXT.French: Nous aimerions vous offrir cette colonie en gage de notre respect.
TEXT.German: Wir möchten diese Siedlung zu Euren Gunsten aufgeben, seid Ihr damit einverstanden?
TEXT.Italian: Vorremmo offrirti questo insediamento in segno di rispetto.
TEXT.Spanish: Nos gustaría ofreceros este asentamiento como muestra de respeto.

TEXT.English: In Colonial Times, European Powers struggled for supremacy in New World. This mod will allow you to feel a bit of that aspect of Colonization history. You will struggle against natives and European Colonies to establish the largest new nation world has ever seen.
TEXT.French: Dans les temps coloniaux, les puissances européens luttaient pour la suprématie dans le Nouveau Monde. Ce mod vous permet de ressentir quelques aspects de cette Histoire colonial, qui marquera à jamais l'Humanité. Vous combatterez vos rivaux européens et indigènes pour établir la plus grande Nation que le monde n'aura jamais connu.
TEXT.German: In den Zeiten der Kolonialisierung kämpften die Europäischen Mächte um die Seeherrschaft in der Neuen Welt. Diese Möglichkeiten habt Ihr auch. Kämpft gegen die Ureinwohner und die anderen Kolonialmächte, um die größte Nation in der Neuen Welt zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: In Colonial Times, European Powers struggled for supremacy in New World. This mod will allow you to feel a bit of that aspect of Colonization history. You will struggle against natives and European Colonies to establish the largest new nation world has ever seen.
TEXT.Spanish: In Colonial Times, European Powers struggled for supremacy in New World. This mod will allow you to feel a bit of that aspect of Colonization history. You will struggle against natives and European Colonies to establish the largest new nation world has ever seen.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Volcanoes[COLOR_REVERT] impassible to all units. They spontaneously erupt on plots with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Peaks[COLOR_REVERT], and remain active for a few turns. During this period, no resources can be won from that plot. Improvements and roads on that plot are destroyed, and on adjacent plots, improvements and roads can be endangered as well. Settlements and units will never be destroyed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A volcano is an opening, or rupture, in a planet's surface or crust, which allows hot, molten rock, ash, and gases to escape from below the surface. Volcanic activity involving the extrusion of rock tends to form mountains or features like mountains over a period of time.
TEXT.French: Un volcan est un ensemble géologique terrestre, sous-marin ou extra-terrestre qui résulte de la montée d'un magma puis de l'éruption d'une partie de ce magma. Le magma provient de la fusion partielle du manteau et exceptionnellement de la croûte terrestre. L'éruption peut se manifester, de manière plus ou moins combinée, par des émissions de lave, par des émanations ou des explosions de gaz, par des projections de tephras, par des phénomènes hydromagmatiques, etc. Les laves refroidies et les retombées de tephras constituent des roches éruptives qui peuvent s'accumuler et atteindre des milliers de mètres d'épaisseur formant ainsi des montagnes ou des îles. Selon la nature des matériaux, le type d'éruption, la fréquence d'éruption et l'orogenèse, les volcans prennent des formes variées, la plus typique étant celle d'une montagne conique couronnée par un cratère ou une caldeira. La définition de ce qu'est un volcan a évolué au cours des derniers siècles en fonction de la connaissance que les géologues en avaient et de la représentation qu'ils pouvaient en donner.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vulkane[COLOR_REVERT] sind für alle Einheiten unpassierbar. Sie brechen spontan auf Gebirgsgipfeln aus und bleiben einige Runden aktiv. Während dieser Zeit kann kein Rohstoff auf dem Gelände gewonnen werden. Geländeverbesserungen und Strassen werden vernichtet. Selbst auf angrenzenden Feldern sind Geländeverbesserungen und Strassen gefährdet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ein Vulkan ist eine geologische Struktur, die entsteht, wenn Magma (Gesteinsschmelze) bis an die Oberfläche eines Planeten (z.B. der Erde) aufsteigt. Alle Begleiterscheinungen, die mit dem Aufstieg und Austritt der glutflüssigen Gesteinsschmelze verbunden sind, bezeichnet man als Vulkanismus. Bei einem Vulkanausbruch werden nicht nur glutflüssige, sondern auch feste oder gasförmige Stoffe freigesetzt (Vulkanismus). Die meisten Vulkane haben annähernd die Form eines Kegels, dessen Hangneigung von der Zähigkeit der Lava abhängt. Die Gestalt kann aber auch unregelmäßig sein oder eine kuppelförmige Aufwölbung bilden.
TEXT.Italian: A volcano is an opening, or rupture, in a planet's surface or crust, which allows hot, molten rock, ash, and gases to escape from below the surface. Volcanic activity involving the extrusion of rock tends to form mountains or features like mountains over a period of time.
TEXT.Spanish: A volcano is an opening, or rupture, in a planet's surface or crust, which allows hot, molten rock, ash, and gases to escape from below the surface. Volcanic activity involving the extrusion of rock tends to form mountains or features like mountains over a period of time.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oases[COLOR_REVERT] occur in flatlands in some [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Deserts[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The New World seemed promising to the colonialists. But there were many forbidding places as well. But a brave man can even farm at these barren places: he just needs to find some water.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Nouveau Monde semblait prometteur pour les colons, mais certaines de ses régions se sont révélées hostiles. Un homme déterminé peut cependant cultiver toute terre à partir du moment où il trouve de l'eau.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oasen[COLOR_REVERT] entstehen gelegentlich in [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Wüsten[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Neue Welt erschien den europäischen Einwanderern häufig wie ein Garten Eden, mit sattem Grün, üppigen Wäldern, exotischen Früchten, ausgedehnten Fischgründen und Urwäldern voller Wild. Doch es gab auch viele unwirtliche Regionen, insbesondere in wasserarmen, abgeschiedenen Gegenden im Landesinneren. Doch umsichtige Bauern können selbst an den unwirtlichsten Stellen Ackerbau betreiben - vorausgesetzt, sie finden eine Wasserstelle.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The New World seemed promising to the colonialists. But there were many forbidding places as well. But a brave man can even farm at these barren places: he just needs to find some water.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The New World seemed promising to the colonialists. But there were many forbidding places as well. But a brave man can even farm at these barren places: he just needs to find some water.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Timber[COLOR_REVERT] can be found in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK] or [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] on all kinds of Terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Lumber or Timber is a term used to describe wood, either standing or that has been processed for use - from the time trees are felled, to its end product as a material suitable for industrial use - as structural material for construction or wood pulp for paper production.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le bois est un matériau particulièrement utilisé en construction. La partie du bois utilisé est généralement le duramen, appelé aussi bois parfait ou bois de cour qui constitue la partie centrale de l'arbre. L'aubier, souvent plus clair et léger que le duramen, est constitué de cellules vivantes. il est plus facilement et rapidement attaqué par les insectes, bactéries et champignons.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Besonders gutes [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bauholz[COLOR_REVERT] lässt sich gelegentlich in der [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK], im [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Dschungel[\LINK] aber auch in anderen [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Wäldern[\LINK] finden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Als die Europäer begannen, die Neue Welt zu kolonisieren, fanden sie in vielen Regionen ausgedehnte Wälder vor. An Holz mangelte es zumeist nicht, um Blockhäuser, Palisaden, Bootstege und Lagerhallen zu errichten. Doch gutes, stabiles Bauholz gab es nur an manchen Orten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Lumber or Timber is a term used to describe wood, either standing or that has been processed for use - from the time trees are felled, to its end product as a material suitable for industrial use - as structural material for construction or wood pulp for paper production.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Lumber or Timber is a term used to describe wood, either standing or that has been processed for use - from the time trees are felled, to its end product as a material suitable for industrial use - as structural material for construction or wood pulp for paper production.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mineral Resources[COLOR_REVERT] can occur on all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hills[COLOR_REVERT] plots.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When early civilizations began to use metal to construct tools and weapons, the most commonly used metal was bronze. Bronze had the advantage of being readily available and easy to work with. Unfortunately, it was too soft to hold an effective edge. In the mid-14th century BC in central Europe, iron replaced bronze as the metal of choice, and the Iron Age was begun. Since this time, iron has been a valuable commodity. In the new world, where easily accessible seams of iron were not always found in the nearby hills, many colonies turned instead to the iron-rich mineral deposits of nearby swamps and marshes.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Quand les hommes commencèrent à fabriquer des outils et des armes en métal, le bronze s'avéra le métal le plus couramment employé. Il avait l'avantage d'être facile à obtenir et à travailler, mais il était trop tendre pour rester longtemps tranchant. Au milieu du XIVe siècle av. J.-C., en Europe centrale, le bronze fut progressivement remplacé par le fer, et l'Age de Fer succéda à l'Age de Bronze. Depuis, le fer est une matière première de premier plan. Les gisements de fer découverts dans les montagnes sont exploités, et le minerai est traité pour être utilisé sous sa forme brute ou dans la production de l'acier.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erzgestein[COLOR_REVERT] kann auf [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hügeln[COLOR_REVERT] jedes Terrains vorkommen..[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Reiche Eisen- oder Silbervorkommen fanden die Europäer in der Neuen Welt nur an ausgewählten Orten vor. Doch häufig trafen sie in Hügeln und Bergen auf Gesteinsschichten, in denen geringe Erzvorkommen vorhanden waren. Nicht immer war ihre Ausbeutung wirtschaftlich sinnvoll, doch mancherorts bot sie den Schürfern eine Möglichkeit, zumindestens ihren Lebensunterhalt zu verdienen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Quando le prime civiltà cominciarono a usare il metallo per costruire oggetti e armi, il più utilizzato era il bronzo; i vantaggi di questo metallo erano la sua facile reperibilità e la semplice lavorazione. Sfortunatamente, si rivelò troppo morbido per creare lame efficaci. A partire dalla metà del 14° secolo a. C., in Europa il bronzo venne sostituito dal ferro, dando così il via all'Età del Ferro. Da allora, il ferro è diventato una risorsa importante: i depositi di questo metallo e i minerali che lo contengono si trovano nelle montagne, dalle quali vengono estratti e processati per essere usati in forma grezza o nella produzione di acciaio.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Cuando las primeras civilizaciones comenzaron a usar metales para fabricar herramientas y armas, el más utilizado era el bronce. Este metal contaba con la ventaja de su gran disponibilidad y de su facilidad a la hora de trabajar con él. Por desgracia, era demasiado blando para poder tener un filo eficaz. A mediados del siglo XIV a. C., el hierro sustituyó al bronce en Europa central como metal preferido, y comenzó la Edad del Hierro. Desde entonces, el hierro ha sido una mercancía valiosa. Los depósitos de mineral de hierro se encuentran en las montañas, y se extraen y procesan para utilizar el hierro en estado puro y en la producción de acero.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Shellfish[COLOR_REVERT] live in shallow waters like [LINK=TERRAIN_COAST]Coasts[\LINK] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fresh Water Lakes[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A pearl is a hard, rounded object produced by certain mollusks, primarily oysters. Pearl is valued as a gemstone and is cultivated or harvested for jewellery. Pearls are formed inside the shell of certain bivalve mollusks. As a response to an irritating object inside its shell, the mollusk will deposit layers of calcium carbonate (CaCO3) in the form of the minerals aragonite or calcite (both crystalline forms of calcium carbonate) held together by an organic horn-like compound called conchiolin. Before the beginning of the 20th Century, pearl hunting was the most common way of harvesting pearls. Divers manually pulled oysters from ocean floors and river bottoms and checked them individually for pearls. Not all natural oysters produce pearls, however. In fact, in a haul of three tonnes, only three or four oysters will produce perfect pearls. Now, however, almost all pearls used for jewelry are cultured by planting a core or nucleus into pearl oysters. The pearls are usually harvested three years after the planting, but it can take up to as long as six years before a pearl is produced. This mariculture process was first developed by Kokichi Mikimoto in Japan, who was granted a patent for the process in 1896. In the past couple of decades, cultured pearls have been produced with larger oysters in the south Pacific and Indian Ocean. One of the largest pearl-bearing oysters is the Pinctada maxima, which is roughly the size of a dinner plate. South Sea pearls are characterized by their large size and silvery color. Sizes up to 14 mm in diameter are not uncommon. Australia is one of the most important sources of South Sea pearls. Tahitian pearls (also referred to as Titian pearls) are also another South Sea pearl. - Wikipedia
TEXT.French: [TAB] Les perles sont de petites billes, ganaralement de couleur blanche, craaes par certains mollusques, principalement les huitres. Quand un objet irritant passe a l'intarieur de la coquille, l'animal raagit en entourant l'objet d'une couche de carbonate de calcium CaCO3 sous la forme d'aragonite ou de calcite. Ce malange est appela nacre. Autrefois uniquement obtenues par le hasard, les perles font aujourd'hui l'objet d'une culture (perliculture). Elle a ata mise au point par les Japonais du dabut du xxe siecle aux annaes 1970. Depuis, le secret de leur technique s'est rapandu dans tout les archipels de l'ocaan Pacifique, et la Polynasie francaise est le principal producteur. - Wikipedia
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Muscheln[COLOR_REVERT] kommen in seichten Gewässern vor, wie [LINK=TERRAIN_COAST]Küsten[\LINK] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Frischwasserseen[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Man muss viele Muscheln öffnen, um von ihrem Fleisch satt zu werden. Doch an den Küsten, an denen die europäische Einwanderer reiche Muschelbänke fanden, fanden sie in ihnen eine wichtige Nahrungsquelle - die Masse macht's.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Le perle sono prodotte dalle ostriche e sono parte integrante del loro organismo, principalmente dalle specie dei mari orientali. Il termine "perla" deriva dal latino "permula", il nome con cui si indicava la conchiglia che la contiene e la cui forma ricorda la "coscia del maiale". Una perla si forma quando un corpo estraneo, come un granello di sabbia, si ferma nella cavita palleale. Esso viene ricoperto da strati successivi di madreperla, allo scopo di difendere i tessuti dell'animale dall'irritazione. Si depositano vari strati di calcio che in combinazione con altri minerali, creano questi particolari oggetti preziosi. La perle ricordiamo che e formata praticamente da nacre meglio conosciuta come madreperla. Per creare perle con forme speciali, quando si estrae la perla dall'ostrica, si immette un frammento di plastica con la forma scelta, che l'ostrica coprira con la madreperla. Il risultato e che, dopo anni di attesa, la perla che nasce ha la forma ingrandita del frammento iniziale. Il colore piu comune nelle perle e il bianco, ma si possono trovare anche perle rosa, color crema, viola scuro, grigie e nere. Grazie alla tecnologia e anni di studio, oggi possiamo anche avere perle con colori bizzarri come il verde, l'azzurro, l'arancione che vengono usate soprattutto nella bigiotteria. Quando si parla di perle nere, oltre alla Akoya e a quelle di fiume, si pensa subito alle costosissime perle di Tahiti, molto pregiate e particolarmente belle. Il valore delle perle pero, non si distingue solo dal colore, ma anche dalla forma e dal lustro, cioe la luce che riesce a riflettere. Una curiosita particolare e che, a differenza delle altre, le ostriche che creano le perle nere sono molto piu delicate e in ogni coltivazione ne muoiono tantissime. Questo e un altro fattore che le rende cosi costose e rare. Ci sono due categorie di perle: le perle di acqua dolce e le perle di acqua salata. Come dice la parola stessa, le perle d'acqua dolce vengono coltivate nei laghi e nei fiumi, mentre le altre provengono dall'oceano e molto spesso dalla lagune. Le tre categorie di perle d'acqua salata sono le Akoya, le perle Tahiti e le costosissime e rare perle South Sea. La madreperla oltre ad essere usata nel mercato dei gioielli, oggi viene usata anche nella cosmetica e per la creazione di particolari vernici. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Se ignora cual fue el primer pueblo que extrajo las perlas de las ostras, para luego usarlas como decoracion. Pero debido a que las perlas tienen lustre y brillo casi inmediatamente salidas de la ostra que las fabrico, es muy posible que desde apocas prehistoricas se haya utilizado las perlas como adorno. Lo que si puede decirse, es que la fabricacion de joyas a base de perlas, era una actividad bastante extendida y favorecida entre los pueblos antiguos. Sin embargo debido a la extrema rareza de las mismas, las perlas eran una de las gemas mas valiosas conocidas por los pueblos del mundo antiguo, reservadas para la nobleza y personajes extremadamente acaudalados. Actualmente las perlas no tienen tanto valor monetario como en apocas pasadas, principalmente debido a que la mayoria de las perlas son cultivadas, resultando en la devaluacion mercantil de las mismas por aumento en la oferta. De alli que numerosas parabolas y dichos que nos han llegado al presente hablando del proverbial valor de las perlas, no tengan la misma consonancia y valor semantico hoy en dia. - Wikipedia

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bisons[COLOR_REVERT] can live in unvegetated flatlands of [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]During Ice Age bisons came from Asia across the frozen Bering Sea to America and spread over the whole continent. Since native Americans knew about the existence of bisons they hunted it. It delivered with food, leather, bones and fur the basics of all the things, native Americans produced. As the Europeans came to America they began to hunt Bisons in a large scale. Due to the installation of the Yellowstone national park the bison became room to stabilize it's numbers.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le bison a été un animal caractéristique de l'Amérique du Nord et un symbole pour de nombreuses cultures amérindiennes. Les Amérindiens des grandes plaines de l'Amérique du Nord avaient une économie largement basée sur le bison. Les bisons d'Amérique du Nord étaient encore 50 à 70 millions avant l'arrivée des Européens en Amérique, vivant et migrant sur les plaines herbeuses d'Amérique du Nord, du Mexique au Canada. Ils ont frisé l'extinction avec la conquête de l'Ouest, l'introduction des chevaux et la construction du chemin de fer (vers 1870-1880), où le massacre des bisons fut une entreprise économique à très grande échelle, mais aussi une stratégie pour affecter les Amérindiens. Buffalo Bill (William Frederick Cody) fut un des plus grands chasseurs de bisons.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Büffel[COLOR_REVERT] können in unbewaldeten Gebieten der [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], des [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Graslandes[\LINK] oder der [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK] vorkommen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Während der Eiszeit wanderten Bisons von Asien über die zugefrorene Beringstraße nach Amerika ein und breiteten sich über den ganzen Kontinent aus. Als vor etwa zehntausend Jahren Vorfahren der Indianer aus Alaska nachrückten und den Doppelkontinent besiedelten, stießen sie auf gewaltige Bisonherden. Der Bison diente ihnen als Nahrung, sein Fell, seine Sehnen und seine Knochen zur Herstellung von Kleidung, Decken, Sätteln, Zaumzeug, Schilden, Seilen, Leim, Kissenfüllungen, Geschirr, Rasseln, Schmuck, Werkzeugen und Tipis - und der Büffelmist als Brennmaterial.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]During Ice Age bisons came from Asia across the frozen Bering Sea to America and spread over the whole continent. Since native Americans knew about the existence of bisons they hunted it. It delivered with food, leather, bones and fur the basics of all the things, native Americans produced. As the Europeans came to America they began to hunt Bisons in a large scale. Due to the installation of the Yellowstone national park the bison became room to stabilize it's numbers.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]During Ice Age bisons came from Asia across the frozen Bering Sea to America and spread over the whole continent. Since native Americans knew about the existence of bisons they hunted it. It delivered with food, leather, bones and fur the basics of all the things, native Americans produced. As the Europeans came to America they began to hunt Bisons in a large scale. Due to the installation of the Yellowstone national park the bison became room to stabilize it's numbers.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salt Deposits[COLOR_REVERT] can occur on all [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Desert[\LINK] plots.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Edible salt is a mineral, one of the few rocks humans eat. Salt is necessary for the survival of all living creatures, including humans. Salt is involved in regulating the water content (fluid balance) of the body. Salt flavor is one of the basic tastes. In the past, salt was difficult to obtain, but had a great importance in food preservation and as a vital food additive. Therefore, it was a highly valued trade item throughout history. Wars were fought over it; states were formed and destroyed because of it. Roman soldiers were partially paid with salt, and this is still evident in the English language as the word salary derives from the Latin word salarium that means payment in salt (Latin sal), as well as the phrase "worth one's salt". It was also of high value to the Hebrews, Greeks and other peoples of antiquity. During the late Roman Empire and throughout the Middle Ages salt was a precious commodity carried along the salt roads into the heartland of the Germanic tribes. Cities, states and dukedoms along the salt roads exacted heavy duties and taxes for the salt passing through their territories. This practice caused wars, it even caused the formation of cities such as the city of Munich in 1158 when the then Duke of Bavaria Henry XII, called The Lion, decided that the bishops of Freising no longer needed their salt revenue. - Wikipedia
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le raffinage permet d'obtenir un sel de la couleur blanche jusqu'ici fréquemment préférée par le consommateur. Il est alors composé de NaCl pratiquement pur (99,9 %), ceci au détriment de ses qualités alimentaires. Le sel du type raffiné reste le plus employé dans l'alimentation. Environ 7 % du sel raffiné est aussi utilisé comme additif, mais la plus grande partie est destinée aux usages industriels (fabrication du papier, réglage de la teinte des textiles et des tissus, production de savons et détergents). Le sel a une forte valeur marchande.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salz[COLOR_REVERT] kann überall in der [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Wüste[\LINK] vorkommen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Salz zählt von altersher und überall in der Welt zu den begehrtesten Gewürzen. Viele traditionelle Fleisch- und Milchspeisen können ohne Salz nicht zubereitet werden. In Südamerika wurde Salz häufig durch das Auswaschen, Filtern und Einkochen salziger Erde gewonnen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il sale e anzitutto un esaltatore di sapidita usato in tutte le tradizioni culinarie conosciute ed e ampiamente sfruttato nell'industria conserviera sia come ingrediente che come mezzo di conservazione dei cibi. Quest'ultima proprieta e dovuta all'effetto disidratante che il sale ha sui materiali con cui viene a contatto, da cui estrae l'acqua per osmosi. Sale da cucina additivato di elementi particolari puo essere prescritto per curare o prevenire alcune malattie (ad esempio il sale iodato per il gozzo o addizionato di cloruro di potassio per l'ipertensione). Il sale e anche un reagente usato in chimica, ad esempio per migliorare la precipitazione dei prodotti al termine di una saponificazione. Un uso importante nell'industria chimica e come materia prima negli impianti cloro-soda, in cui viene eseguita l'elettrolisi della salamoia di cloruro di sodio per ottenere cloro gassoso, idrogeno e soda caustica, tutte materie prime fondamentali per l'industria chimica. Il sale trova impiego anche come anti-gelo: sparso sulle superfici ghiacciate, ne provoca lo scioglimento, dato che una miscela di ghiaccio e sale forma un eutettico il cui punto di fusione e inferiore ai meno 10 gradi celsius. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La sal se puede emplear en la alimentacion con dos objetivos diferentes, por un lado su capacidad de realzar ciertos sabores hace que sea un condimento muy habitual, por otro lado su capacidad de conservar alimentos hace que sea adecuado para la elaboracion de salazones y encurtidos. Se puede decir que el uso de la sal en la alimentacion se centra en estas dos actividades. Muchos de los alimentos poseen una etimologias que recuerdan a la sal como uno de los ingredientes base, ejemplos de ello son: las ensaladas, las salchichas (proveniente del latin salsus: en sal) y las salsas, el salmorejo, etc. El uso de sal en las elaboraciones de ciertos alimentos ha ido descendiendo desde el siglo XVIII, esta afirmacion puede comprobarse en los libros de recetas en los que puede verse un uso 'excesivo' de sal para los gustos de hoy en dia. Se han realizado investigaciones acerca del consumo de sal en los humanos occidentales, y se ha podido comprobar que el 10% de la sal que se ingiere proviene de forma natural de los alimentos, el 15% proviene de lo que se anade durante la elaboraccion casera de los alimentos y el 75% proviene de lo que anaden las industrias alimentarias en el procesado de los alimentos. Estos estudios muestran que un britanico medio a finales del siglo XX consumia cerca de 10 gramos de sal (en mas detalle 10.7 gramos de sal en un varon y 8.0 gramos para las mujeres). Estos datos indican que una dieta baja en sal debe regularse principalmente en la compra de los productos ademas de reducir su cantidad durante el cocinado. Esta probado que las dietas bajas en sal son pobres en sabores, pudiendo afectar incluso a los aromas. La sal al ser consumida induce a provocar un mayor apetito por los alimentos, este efecto es aprovechado a veces por la industria de alimentacion e incluye a veces un alto contenido de sal en los alimentos con el objeto de que se consuma mas. De todas formas la sal posee ventajas en el procesado de alimentos: resulta barata, potencia sabores, elimina sabores acidos, extiende la vida de los alimentos, hace que pesen mas ya que retiene humedad. Algunos autores han investigado la preferencia animal por la sal desde un fundamento endocrino Uno de los sistemas hormonales para la regulacion del sodio en el cuerpo es angiotensina, se ha demostrado que esta hormona es capaz de regular la sensacion de sed, se sabe que esta hormona puede tener influencia en la preferencia psicologica por la sal. Existen casos investigados en los que un tratamiento hormonal (mediante la adrenomedulina denominada ADM) puede llegar a reducir el apetito por la sal. El apetito innato de los animales (incluido el hombre) por la sal ha despertado numerosas investigaciones acerca del efecto y preferencias por el sabor salado, parece ser que los recien nacidos no parecen distinguir el sabor salado y no es hasta pasados cuatro meses desde su nacimiento cuando empiezan a distinguirlo. De la misma forma se sabe la dependencia de la sal disminuye si se disminuye su consumo, este efecto de dependencia dura solo un par de semanas y posteriormente las personas se acostumbran a una dieta baja en sales. El apetito por la sal puede tener una dependencia climatica, por ejemplo, las personas que viven en climas frios pueden tener en sus gastronomias locales una presencia mayor por los alimentos con fuerte sabor salado. - Wikipedia

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Potatoes[COLOR_REVERT] grow on [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain that is either open or overgrown by [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forest[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The potato (plural form: potatoes) (Solanum tuberosum) is a perennial plant of the Solanaceae, or nightshade, family, grown for its starchy tuber. In recent centuries potatoes have become the world's most important tuber crop and its fourth most important source of food energy (after rice, wheat, and maize): farmers and gardeners grow them world-wide. Growers cultivate thousands of different varieties of potato. The potato originated in the Andes, in the area of present-day Peru. Pre-Columbian inhabitants of the Andean cultures cultivated around 200 different kinds of potatoes. Archeological evidence suggests that humans have cultivated the potato for at least 7,000 years. By the seventeenth century the potato had become firmly established as a staple of Europe's poor, leading richer people to spurn it, although this changed gradually, with Antoine-Augustin Parmentier's persuading King Louis XVI of France of the value of the crop. The soup potage Parmentier takes its name from the great horticulturalist. By the end of the 18th century the potato had become popular in France, due to the advocacy of Parmentier. Today, potatoes grow widely in Europe, especially in North European countries such as the British Isles, Germany, Poland, and Russia, due to their ability to thrive in cold, damp climates. Because the potato grew so well in Northern Europe, it may have contributed to the population-explosion there in the 19th century - though not in other centuries. - Wikipedia
TEXT.French: [TAB] La pomme de terre est une plante vivace herbacae dont le nom ganarique (Solanum) dasignait chez les Romains une variata de morelle. Outre Solanum tuberosum, il existe de nombreuses variatas sauvages poussant en Amarique du Sud, par exemple S. jamesii, S. commersioni, S. maglia ou S. andigenum. Certaines de ces especes, en raison de leur rasistance au froid, de leur pracocita, de leur rasistance aux maladies, ont ata utilisaes pour amaliorer les variatas cultivaes en Europe ou en craer de nouvelles. Le tubercule n'appartient pas a la racine de la plante, mais a sa tige enterrae dont partent des rameaux plus greles appelas rhizomes, a l'extramita desquels se forment les tubercules. a la surface de ces derniers se trouvent les " yeux ", ou bourgeons, qui ont la particularita d'etre disposas de facon halicoidale. Ces yeux se transforment en germes apres une pariode plus ou moins longue de repos. Le tubercule comporte une forte proportion d'eau, pouvant aller jusqua 80 %, ainsi que des matieres amylacaes (la facule), du sucre, des matieres albuminoides, des fibres cellulosiques, des alaments minaraux, des diastases et des vitamines (vitamine C, surtout prasente dans la peau) et des toxines (voir plus loin). Les fleurs, groupaes en cymes, comportent cinq sapales et cinq patales soudas formant une sorte de roue a cinq pointes. Elles sont ganaralement blanches ou mauves, mais parfois aussi bleues, pourpres ou violet fonca. Le fruit est une baie, sorte de petite tomate tres ronde renfermant de tres nombreuses graines. - Wikipedia
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kartoffeln[COLOR_REVERT] wachsen auf [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grasland[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK] oder [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK]. Gelegentlich können besonders gute Anbaugebiete für Kartoffeln auch von [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Buschland[\LINK] überwachsen sein.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Kartoffel ist in großen Teilen der Welt ein wichtiges Grundnahrungsmittel. Sie stammt aus den südamerikanischen Anden. Dort lernten die Spanier in der ersten Hälfte des 16. Jahrhunderts von den Inka die Frucht Papa (aus Quechua: die Knolle) kennen. In Europa wurde sie Patata genannt - der englische Name potatoes erinnert noch heute daran, ebenso wie die alte deutsche Bezeichnung Batate, die heute die Süßkartoffel bezeichnet. Nach Europa wurde die Kartoffel zuerst wegen der schönen Blüte und des üppigen Laubes als reine Zierpflanze importiert und als seltene Pflanze in botanische Gärten aufgenommen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] I tuberi, la parte commestibile della pianta, si sviluppano dal rigonfiamento della parte terminale, epigea, dei lunghi stoloni sotterranei. Il rigonfiamento si forma per il trasporto e l'accumulo dei carboidrati fotosintetizzati dalla parte aerea della pianta, quando essa raggiunge la maturita. I tuberi, quindi, fungono da organo di riserva. La tuberificazione e favorita dall'assenza di luce, dalla temperatura e dall'umidita del suolo. L'accorciarsi del giorno, le basse temperature notturne e l'aumentare dell'umidita, infatti, stimolano gli stoloni a produrre una maggiore quantita di citochinine, degli ormoni vegetali che favoriscono la divisione cellulare. Quando comincia la formazione del tubero, questo diventa il meristema principale e la crescita di tutti gli altri organi rallenta considerevolmente. I tuberi presentano un epidermide sottile ricoperta da piccole lenticelle, suberificate in condizioni di mancanza d'acqua. La presenza di acqua favorisce la crescita di cellule corticali che rompono il sughero e formano delle aperture nelle lenticelle. Al di sotto dell'epidermide si trova il periderma, il floema lo xilema ed il midollo. Tutti questi tessuti sono collegati agli "occhi", delle strutture da cui si originano delle gemme, che rimangono dormienti durante lo sviluppo del tubero ma che possono originare nuovi steli. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] La papa o patata (Solanum tuberosum) es una especie perteneciente a la familia de las Solanaceas, originaria de Amarica del Sur y cultivada en todo el mundo por sus tubarculos comestibles. Domesticada en el altiplano andino por sus habitantes hace 7000 anos, fue llevada a Europa por los conquistadores espanoles mas como una curiosidad botanica que como una planta alimenticia. Con el tiempo su consumo fue creciendo y su cultivo se expandio a todo el mundo hasta posicionarse como uno de los principales para el ser humano. asta continua siendo la base de la alimentacion de millones de personas, una delicia culinaria en muchisimas regiones del globo que han creado decenas de platos que la tienen de protagonista y, ademas, su estudio representa un verdadero desafio para cientificos de varias disciplinas quienes tratan de dilucidar su origen, genatica y fisiologia. Mas aun, adentrados en el campo de la tecnologia, encuentran una gran cantidad de aplicaciones no convencionales para este tubarculo, desde los cosmaticos hasta el papel prensa. - Wikipedia

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tornadoes[COLOR_REVERT] make a plot impassible to all units. They can spontaneously form on any land plot, and remain active for a few turns. During this period, no resources can be won from that plot, and improvements and roads on that plot are destroyed, and on adjacent plots, improvements and roads can be endangered as well. Settlements and units will never be destroyed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A tornado is a violent, rotating column of air which is in contact with both the surface of the earth and a cumulonimbus cloud or, in rare cases, the base of a cumulus cloud. Tornadoes come in many sizes but are typically in the form of a visible condensation funnel, whose narrow end touches the earth and is often encircled by a cloud of debris.
TEXT.French: Une tornade est un vortex (tourbillon) de vents extrêmement violents, prenant naissance à la base d'un nuage d'orage (cumulonimbus) lorsque les conditions de cisaillement des vents sont favorables dans la basse atmosphère. De très faibles tornades peuvent également se développer sous des nuages d'averses (cumulus bourgeonnant).
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tornados[COLOR_REVERT] sind für alle Einheiten unpassierbar. Sie können sich spontan auf dem Land bilden und bleiben einige wenige Runden aktiv. Während dieser Zeit können auf dem Feld keine Rohstoffe gewonnen werden. Geländeverbesserungen und Strassen werden zerstört. Auch auf benachbarten Feldern sind Geländeverbesserungen und Strassen in Gefahr. Siedlungen sind jedoch nicht gefährdet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ein Tornado, auch Wind- oder Wasserhose genannt, ist ein kleinräumiger Luftwirbel in der Erdatmosphäre, der eine annähernd senkrechte Drehachse aufweist und im Zusammenhang mit konvektiver Bewölkung (Cumulus und Cumulonimbus) steht. Der Wirbel erstreckt sich hierbei durchgehend vom Boden bis zur Wolkenuntergrenze und ist von einem Staubwolke umgeben.
TEXT.Italian: A tornado is a violent, rotating column of air which is in contact with both the surface of the earth and a cumulonimbus cloud or, in rare cases, the base of a cumulus cloud. Tornadoes come in many sizes but are typically in the form of a visible condensation funnel, whose narrow end touches the earth and is often encircled by a cloud of debris.
TEXT.Spanish: A tornado is a violent, rotating column of air which is in contact with both the surface of the earth and a cumulonimbus cloud or, in rare cases, the base of a cumulus cloud. Tornadoes come in many sizes but are typically in the form of a visible condensation funnel, whose narrow end touches the earth and is often encircled by a cloud of debris.

TEXT.English: Player %s1_player has withdrawn from the new world.
TEXT.French: Las de l'insuccès de %s1_player, son Roi a décidé de retirer du Nouveau Monde l'ensemble de ses explorateurs, soldats et colons.
TEXT.German: Zunächst hat %s1_player das Schlachtenglück verlassen - und nun verliert er auch noch die Gunst seines Königs, der es leid ist, zum Gespött der ganzen Welt zu werden. Majestät geruhen, alle Entdecker, Soldaten und Kolonisten aus der Neuen Welt zurück nach Europa zu beordern.
TEXT.Italian: Player %s1_player has withdrawn from the new world.
TEXT.Spanish: Player %s1_player has withdrawn from the new world.

TEXT.English: TAC-version of Western Hemisphere (Huge): realistic and coherent temperate zones, authentic rivers, authentic mountains, authentic islands, fixing of several river bugs, fair balanced transferplots and starting positions
TEXT.French: Version TAC de l'hémisphère Ouest (Immense):zones tempérées réalistes et cohérentes, fleuves, montagnes, îles authentiques à la réalité avec quelques ajustements dans l'intérêt du jeu.
TEXT.German: TAC-Variante der Gesamtamerika-Karte Western Hemisphere (Huge): authentische und zusammenhängende Klimazonen, authentische Flüsse, authentische Höhenzüge, korrekt platzierte Inseln, fair verteilte Überfahrtsfelder nach Europa; Fixing von Flüssen, die stromaufwärts flossen oder im Binnenland versickerten; Fixing von bewaldeten Meeresfeldern
TEXT.Italian: TAC-version of Western Hemisphere (Huge): realistic and coherent temperate zones, authentic rivers, authentic mountains, authentic islands, fixing of several river bugs, fair balanced transferplots and starting positions
TEXT.Spanish: TAC-version of Western Hemisphere (Huge): realistic and coherent temperate zones, authentic rivers, authentic mountains, authentic islands, fixing of several river bugs, fair balanced transferplots and starting positions

TEXT.English: TAC-version of Northwest Passage: realistic and coherent temperate zones, authentic rivers, authentic mountains, fixing of several river bugs, new Pazific transferplots, only five Atlantic transferplots und starting positions for different temperate zones and different game experiences
TEXT.French: Version TAC du passage par le Nord Ouest (Immense):zones tempérées réalistes et cohérentes, fleuves, montagnes, îles authentiques à la réalité avec seulement 5 cases d'accès à l'Europe par l'Atlantique servant chacune de position de départ pour diversifier les expériences de jeu.
TEXT.German: TAC-Variante der Karte Northwest Passage: nur Indianervölker aus Nordamerika, authentische und zusammenhängende Klimazonen, authentische Flüsse, authentische Höhenzüge, erstmals Pazifik-Überfahrtsfelder, nur noch fünf, fair verteilte Überfahrtsfelder im Atlantik, die als Startpositionen in verschiedene Klimazonen führen, die unterschiedliche Herausforderungen bieten; Fixing von Flüssen, die stromaufwärts flossen oder im Binnenland versickerten
TEXT.Italian: TAC-version of Northwest Passage: realistic and coherent temperate zones, authentic rivers, authentic mountains, fixing of several river bugs, new Pazific transferplots, only five Atlantic transferplots und starting positions for different temperate zones and different game experiences
TEXT.Spanish: TAC-version of Northwest Passage: realistic and coherent temperate zones, authentic rivers, authentic mountains, fixing of several river bugs, new Pazific transferplots, only five Atlantic transferplots und starting positions for different temperate zones and different game experiences

TEXT.English: TAC-version of South America: transferplots optimized, fixing of several river bugs, more rivers, more plots with jungle and peaks, Patagonia with less desert plots and more lumber
TEXT.French: Version TAC de l'Amérique du Sud avec quelques ajustements au niveau des fleuves, de la jungle et du désert en Patagonie.
TEXT.German: TAC-Variante der Karte South America: nur Indianervölker aus Südamerika, mehr Dschungel, mehr Berge, mehr Flüsse, ausgeglichener balancierte Atlantik-Überfahrtsfelder, erstmals Pazifik-Überfahrtsfelder, Südzipfel mit weniger Wüste und erstmals mit Holzquellen; Fixing von Flüssen, die stromaufwärts flossen oder im Binnenland versickerten
TEXT.Italian: TAC-version of South America: transferplots optimized, fixing of several river bugs, more rivers, more plots with jungle and peaks, Patagonia with less desert plots and more lumber
TEXT.Spanish: TAC-version of South America: transferplots optimized, fixing of several river bugs, more rivers, more plots with jungle and peaks, Patagonia with less desert plots and more lumber

TEXT.English: TAC-map of Central America: from the Caribic Sea to Mexico, from the Mississippi River to Amazon
TEXT.French: Version TAC de l'Amérique Centrale : de la mer des Caraïbes au Mexique, du Mississippi à l'Amazone.
TEXT.German: TAC-Karte von Zentralamerika: von den Karibischen Inseln bis Mexiko, vom Mississippi-Delta bis hin zum Amazonasdschungel
TEXT.Italian: TAC-map of Central America: from the Caribic Sea to Mexico, from the Mississippi River to Amazon
TEXT.Spanish: TAC-map of Central America: from the Caribic Sea to Mexico, from the Mississippi River to Amazon

TEXT.English: Huge TAC-map of the East Coast of North America. Technically defined as a small map so that there will be only settlements of the four North American native tribes. From Newfoundland to Florida, from the Great Lakes to the Atlantic.
TEXT.French: Version TAC de la côte Est Nord-Américaine. Défini volontairement comme une petite carte pour n'abriter que 4 tribus Nord-Américaines. De Terre-Neuve à la Floride, des Grands Lacs à l'Atlantique.
TEXT.German: Riesige TAC-Karte der Ostküste Nordamerikas. Technisch als "kleine" Karte ausgewiesen, damit sie nur von den vier Indianerstämmen des Nordens besiedelt ist. Von Neufundland bis Florida, von den Großen Seen bis zur Atlantikküste.
TEXT.Italian: Huge TAC-map of the East Coast of North America. Technically defined as a small map so that there will be only settlements of the four North American native tribes. From Newfoundland to Florida, from the Great Lakes to the Atlantic.
TEXT.Spanish: Huge TAC-map of the East Coast of North America. Technically defined as a small map so that there will be only settlements of the four North American native tribes. From Newfoundland to Florida, from the Great Lakes to the Atlantic.
